channel.title: Please help
channel.description:
ok... how to make a command that takes me here when anyone types "::home" [img]http://imgtool.in/images/xandy.png[/img]
and how to take me here when someone types "::train" [img]http://imgtool.in/images/xandy2.png[/img]
and please dont give me in depth codes i just wanna know what folder to put this in... what code to put it above or under and.. what code to put in... last guy that tryed to help me every bit of code he told me was wrong and didnt work so please someone help me that know what their doing :) thank u if u help me

item.title: Please help
item.dc:creator: @Waterfire Waterfire
item.description:
@Waterfire wrote:

[quote=“dylan.hurley, post:4, topic:417290”]i dont like to spooon feed but here

if (playerCommand.equals("(command)") && (c.playerRights >= 0)) { c.getPA().startTeleport((xcoord), )ycoord), (hcoord), "modern"); c.sendMessage("(message if you want)"); }

remove

if you dont want a message

note: this is for pi only[/quote]What’s pi? sorry I only just started learning C++ this year in school… so I don’t really know alot about coding… except for console applications… that’s about it…

OR learn to code and don’t copy and paste a command as simple as this.
[/quote]

Sorry, not everyone is advanced as you are.

if(command.equals("Home") { toX = ####; toY = ####; }

Same for train.[/quote]you are correct about being advanced but shouldnt really say much because he has been a big help for many ppl in just 1 night

item.title: Please help
item.dc:creator: @codyskate5021 codyskate5021
item.description:
@codyskate5021 wrote:

[quote=“Waterfire, post:1, topic:417290”]ok… how to make a command that takes me here when anyone types “::home”

and how to take me here when someone types “::train”

and please dont give me in depth codes i just wanna know what folder to put this in… what code to put it above or under and… what code to put in…
last guy that tryed to help me every bit of code he told me was wrong and didnt work so please someone help me that know what their doing thank u if u help me[/quote]
really easy go into commands.java if there is already a “home” command then do ctrl + f then type “home” change the x coord and y coord to what you want new home to be.
